channel.title: Hacking A Private server?
channel.description:
Just have been curious on how people are pulling this off, This is not meant for runescape private servers (There mostly gay anyways)
I would like to know so i can make my wow private server a little more secure =) Yes, I have been to Google, and no i have not found anything that could possibly answer my question.
If you could shed some light that would be very very nice =)

item.title: Hacking A Private server?
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

i never noticed ne problems with security on my wow server, maybe search that one masive multiplayer hacks site, see how it works, and code against it, sept wow servers… hmm u cant just code them like rs servers, they are a bit harder.

Read full topic

item.title: Hacking A Private server?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:86577”][quote author=MoO link=topic=127021.msg1238728#msg1238728 date=1177886464]
Frank_ Im not writing my own server (that would take forever) Im using a server package that i really like, but it isn’t the best under security (has quite a few bugs) and people are abusing those bugs (with software such as wpe?)
[/quote]

If they are abusing bugs with WPE then you have to add more server side checks on things. Like if the server receives a packet that says they just attacked a certain monster, make sure they are close enough to that monster to be attacking it, and if they aren’t, don’t give them more XP. Unfortunatly this is going to require some (maybe a lot) of programming on your part, but there is no other way around it.[/quote]

The thing is mopar, only the real server coders can manage to do this, I’m sure your aware most servers have just a few minor edits such as simply copy + paste from tutorials to make it look cool or something similar.

I’m sure if someone was to release a tutorial on server security, every server would have it, but a guide on server security, then only a few would bother to implement it.

Read full topic

item.title: Hacking A Private server?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

MoO:

Frank_ Im not writing my own server (that would take forever) Im using a server package that i really like, but it isn’t the best under security (has quite a few bugs) and people are abusing those bugs (with software such as wpe?)

If they are abusing bugs with WPE then you have to add more server side checks on things. Like if the server receives a packet that says they just attacked a certain monster, make sure they are close enough to that monster to be attacking it, and if they aren’t, don’t give them more XP. Unfortunatly this is going to require some (maybe a lot) of programming on your part, but there is no other way around it.

Read full topic

item.title: Hacking A Private server?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Use logic. Using rs2 servers as an analogy, if someone offers to trade an item, make sure they have that item. If someone indicates they are picking up an something, assure that something exists, etc.
Just because the client would never send fake information under normal circumstances does not mean you will never recieve fake information.

Read full topic
